bibl.title: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, September 22, 1950

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that members of the Reed Memorial Association will meet with Sidney Wallach to discuss his proposed publicity campaign. He regrets that Hench will be unable to attend the Association meeting, and offers to change the date to accommodate him.

div1.head: Letter from J.F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, September 22, 1950

JOSEPH F. SILER

MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
This will acknowledge receipt of your note of September 19th. I am sorry
indeed that you have been ill and hope you are completely recovered.

Mr. Sidney Wallach is very anxious to consult with us about the publicity
campaign to commemorate Walter Reed. Three or four members of the Walter Reed
Board are away but I have written Mr. Wallach that some of us will be glad to
meet him some time in the next ten days and let him tell us what he wants.

I regret very much that you are going to be unable to attend the annual
meeting. It is so important that I am wondering if you could arrange to stop
off here on your way back from Europe. We usually have the meeting at about
the time of Reed's birthday but the date could be changed to fit in with the
time you would be in the east after your arrival from Europe. I should like
very much to have you present.

closer.signed:
J. F. Siler
Col., (MC), U.S.A., Ret'd
Secretary, Walter Reed Memorial
Association
